Questions.Question: Which of the following is correct about variable naming conventions in C#?
Options: A name must begin with a letter that could be followed by a sequence of letters, digits (0 - 9) or underscore
The first character in an identifier cannot be a digit.

Questions.Question: Which of the following is correct about value type variables in C#?
Options: The value types directly contain data.
int, char, and float, which stores numbers, alphabets, and floating point numbers, respectively are value types.
When you declare an int type, the system allocates memory to store the value.

Questions.Question: Which of the following converts a floating point or integer type to a decimal type in C#?
Which of the following operator returns the size of a data type in C#?
Which of the following method copies the actual value of an argument into the formal parameter of the function?
Which of the following property of Array class in C# gets a 32-bit integer, the total number of elements in all the dimensions of the Array?
Which of the following is the correct about class constructor?
Options: A class constructor is a special member function of a class that is executed whenever we create new objects of that class
A constructor has exactly the same name as that of class and it does not have any return type

Questions.Question: Dynamic polymorphism is implemented by abstract classes and virtual functions.
Which of the following preprocessor directive defines a sequence of characters as symbol in C#?
User-defined exception classes are derived from the ApplicationException class in C#?
Which of the following preprocessor directives defines a region in Visual Studio editor?
